Content: Which claim best describes the relationship between the frequency and wavelength of waves in the electromagnetic spectrum?

A.Choice: Waves with a higher frequency have a shorter wavelength.

B.Choice: Waves with a higher frequency have a longer wavelength.

C.Choice: Waves with a lower frequency have a shorter wavelength.

D.Choice: There is no relationship between frequency and wavelength of waves.

Content: A student wants to develop a model that demonstrates the transmission of waves. Which concept should the student include in the model to show how the transmission of visible light is different from the transmission of sound waves?

A.Choice: Light and sound waves can be transmitted through space.

B.Choice: Light can be transmitted through space and matter, but sound waves can only be transmitted through matter.

C.Choice: Light can be transmitted through different forms of matter, but sound waves can only be transmitted through space.

D.Choice: Light can be transmitted only through space, and sound waves can be transmitted through space and matter.

Content: The models below represent the paths of visible light rays as the visible light rays interact with blocks made of different materials, labeled A and B.
problems/NY24G8S/media/3a.jpg
problems/NY24G8S/media/3b.jpg
Based on the behavior of these visible light rays, which claim can be made about materials A or B?

A.Choice: Material A is transparent because the light ray is transmitted.

B.Choice: Material A is transparent because the light ray is absorbed.

C.Choice: Material B is transparent because the light ray is transmitted.

D.Choice: Material B is transparent because the light ray is absorbed.

Content: The model below shows sound waves being emitted from a cell phone.
problems/NY24G8S/media/5a.jpg
Explain what happens to the sound if the amplitude of the waves increases.
How were two traits altered that resulted in modern day corn plants?

A.Choice: The number of branches and the number of flowers increased.

B.Choice: The number of branches and the amount of edible food decreased.

C.Choice: The number of branches decreased, but the amount of edible food increased.

D.Choice: The number of flowers decreased, but the number of branches increased.

Content: Identify the type of technique used to produce corn from teosinte and cite the evidence in the information to support your choice.

A.Choice: Selective breeding

B.Choice: Genetic engineering

Content: Explain, in terms of offspring traits, why sexual reproduction and NOT asexual reproduction was used to produce corn plants from teosinte plants.

Insect pests damage a large amount of corn every year. One way scientists have successfully solved this problem is by growing a variety of corn that has an insect-resistant gene, the Bt gene, spliced into its genetic material. The Bt gene is cut from specific bacteria and inserted into the genetic material of corn. Insects feeding on this “Bt corn” get sick and die soon after. The chart below illustrates and describes a part of the process.
problems/NY24G8S/media/9a.jpg
Adding the genetic material from the bacterium to the genetic material of the corn is an example of

A.Choice: natural selection

B.Choice: biodiversity

C.Choice: gene therapy

D.Choice: genetic modification

Content: Sometimes traits that are not expected show up in organisms such as corn. Some of these traits are desirable, while others are harmful. The model below shows a structural change occurring in a chromosome.
problems/NY24G8S/media/10a.jpg
Which change would NOT result in a new trait being seen in future generations of corn?

A.Choice: a mutation in the genetic material of a leaf

B.Choice: an alteration in the genes of a sex cell

C.Choice: a change in chromosomes during the production of seeds

D.Choice: a modification of the genetic material in pollen

Content: The graph below shows how the changes in acres of Bt corn grown from 1996 to 2008 have influenced the amount of insecticide used per acre over that same period of time.
problems/NY24G8S/media/11a.jpg
The graph indicates that the design solution of adding the Bt gene into corn plants helps protect the stability of an ecosystem by

A.Choice: keeping the amount of insecticide used constant

B.Choice: keeping the amount of corn grown constant

C.Choice: decreasing the amount of insecticide used

D.Choice: decreasing the amount of Bt corn grown

Content: Describe how the kinetic energy of the THREE skaters was affected as a result of the mass of each skater. Use quantitative information from any ONE ramp position on the graph to support your answer
The data table below shows the speed (m/s) and kinetic energy (J) of the 80-kg skater from position 0 to position 5.
problems/NY24G8S/media/13a.jpg

The student wants to show the data for the speed (m/s) and kinetic energy (J) of the 80-kilogram skater from position 0 to position 5. From the choices provided, match with the correct labels to identify:

:ibox:• the names of the correct independent and dependent variable
• the appropriate range and interval (per grid space) for the data
Which table summarizes the relationship between the speed of a skater and the skater's kinetic energy?

A.Choice: problems/NY24G8S/media/14a.jpg

B.Choice: problems/NY24G8S/media/14b.jpg

C.Choice: problems/NY24G8S/media/14c.jpg

D.Choice: problems/NY24G8S/media/14d.jpg

Content: If friction is NOT present, the mass of the skateboarder does NOT affect their speed at positions on the half-pipe.

:ibox:The formula for Kinetic Energy is: KE = (1/2)mv²

KE = Kinetic energy (J)
m = mass (kg)
v = speed (m/s)

Use the data from the Speed and Kinetic Energy of 80-kg Skater table to complete the formula and calculate the kinetic energy of a 50-kg skateboarder at the position at the bottom of the ramp (position 5).
KE = :FR-3: J
problems/NY24G8S/media/16a.jpg
Which statement explains how the model of the ramp shown would need to be modified in order to increase the potential energy of the skater at position 10?

A.Choice: The elevation of the ramp above ground would have to decrease to 2 meters.

B.Choice: The elevation of the ramp above ground would have to increase to greater than 4 meters.

C.Choice: The length of the ramp would have to double and remain at the same elevation.

D.Choice: The length of the ramp would be reduced by half and remain at the same elevation.

Content: Explain how these monitoring methods have made a positive impact on the total water used by comparing the data of 2014 to the data of 2018.
The map below shows the location of the town water district's reservoir. The photograph below shows a portion of the reservoir as seen from a location on the highway heading east.
problems/NY24G8S/media/18a.jpg
problems/NY24G8S/media/18b.jpg
Which explanation identifies how past geologic processes are responsible for the distribution of water located in this town?

A.Choice: The large amount of water found in the reservoir is a result of land uplift and heavy precipitation over the last 1000 years.

B.Choice: Rivers that feed into the reservoir were formed by past erosion of land surfaces and are the main source of water for the reservoir.

C.Choice: Rivers and reservoirs form every year as a result of water coming from melting ice and snow in the springtime.

D.Choice: Water is distributed equally throughout Albany County because of past mountain building processes caused by tectonic plate motion.

Content: The location of a road next to the reservoir can pose problems for maintaining water quality and usage. Which argument describes a correct relationship between the need to put salt on roads to keep roads safe in winter and its impact on water quality of the nearby reservoir?

A.Choice: Salt from roads can travel to the reservoir and contaminate the water and nearby wells.

B.Choice: A certain amount of salt is needed by organisms, so putting salt on roads has little effect on water quality, usage, and nearby ecosystems.

C.Choice: Putting salt on roads for safety reasons also kills plants near the reservoirs, which increases the amount of water in the reservoir that can be used by humans.

D.Choice: Putting salt on roads in winter will have no effect on water quality and usage because salt and water do not react.

Content: A reservoir is an important design method for providing a large continuous source of water. It can also be used to produce electricity. Many areas of the United States have man-made reservoirs. The Colorado River Basin is a significant water source for several states. Dams and reservoirs have been built to provide greater access to this water.

Lake Mead, in both Arizona and Nevada is the largest reservoir in the United States. It supplies water to millions of people in seven states. Water levels have been trending downward for the last 22 years. One reason for the decline is the worst drought in 100 years.
problems/NY24G8S/media/20a.jpg
problems/NY24G8S/media/20b.jpg

Determine the approximate amount of water, in feet, that has been lost from Lake Mead between January 2000 and June 2022. Based on the trend, describe one action that residents in the seven states could take to limit the negative effects of this change in water level.

The three satellite images below were taken of the area around location X on the Colorado River Basin map. The lighter areas on the outside of the river are mineral deposits of the lakeshore that were once underwater or dissolved in the water.
problems/NY24G8S/media/21a.jpg
Scientists have been using both global and local technologies to monitor the amount of water in the Colorado River Basin. The technologies have helped government agencies to conclude that

A.Choice: the amount of water in waterways is influenced by the presence of minerals dissolved in the water requiring more water purification plants

B.Choice: flood mitigation plans are needed because the amount of water in the Colorado River Basin is increasing at a slow rate

C.Choice: there was a cyclic trend to the amount of water in the Colorado River Basin between 2000 and 2022 therefore no new mitigation plans are needed

D.Choice: water conservation plans are needed because water levels in the rivers leading into Lake Mead are a major cause for the downward trend in lake surface elevation

Content: The graph below compares the historical water supply and usage to the predicted future water supply and usage for the Colorado River Basin. Volume of water is in million acre-feet. One acre foot is approximately the amount of water needed to cover a football field (about an acre) with one foot of water. Data on historical supply and use was not collected from 1933 to 1944.
problems/NY24G8S/media/22a.jpg

Scientists have inferred that the increase in human population is responsible for the pattern of water usage. Construct an argument, supported by evidence, for how this increasing human population will impact the future usage of water in the Colorado River Basin and how this usage will impact the Colorado River Basin.
Which statement can be supported using evidence from the photographs in the Stages of Embryonic Development chart and the embryonic images?

A.Choice: Only the crocodile and snake embryos have tails.

B.Choice: The mouse, chicken, and crocodile embryos develop similar outer coverings.

C.Choice: Eyes are present during all stages of embryonic development for all four organisms.

D.Choice: All four organisms have limbs at some point during their embryonic development.

Content: The photographs below show the adult form of the four organisms from the Stages of Embryonic Development chart.
problems/NY24G8S/media/24a.jpg

Below are four organisms and structures associated with these organisms. Indicate whether each structure is found in the Embryo Stage only, the Adult Stage only, or in both the Embryo and Adult stages.

B:Mouse - Four Limbs.Choice: 3:Found in Both Embryo and Adult Stages

C:Crocodile - Eyes.Choice: 3:Found in Both Embryo and Adult Stages

Content: :ibox:Baby Yingliang

In 2000, a dinosaur embryo fossil was discovered in east China and is now housed in the Yingliang Stone Natural History Museum where it was dubbed “Baby Yingliang.” Estimated to be 27 centimeters long from head to tail, the creature lies inside a 17-cm-long egg. Paleontologists believe it belongs to a toothless theropod dinosaur, or oviraptorosaur, dating back 72 to 66 million years, within the Cretaceous Period.
problems/NY24G8S/media/25a.jpg
Scientists have inferred that Baby Yingliang has a strong evolutionary relationship with the chicken. Identify TWO pieces of evidence that supports this inference.
Scientists who study dinosaurs compare not only their embryological development, but also their behavior in how they protect their eggs in which the embryos are found.

For millions of years, parents across the animal kingdom have cared for their eggs and young, providing both time and resources. Nest building is a common behavior in many organisms, such as modern day birds and crocodiles. Some of these animals cover their nests entirely and leave them. Others leave their nests open and incubate the eggs by brooding, or sitting on the nest, to keep the eggs warm and protected.
The table below lists four dinosaur types and the nesting behaviors thought to be associated with each type.
problems/NY24G8S/media/26a.jpg
Identify and explain how ONE specific behavior is thought to have helped dinosaurs increase the probability of successful reproduction.

The Oviraptorosaurus is a descendant of a group of dinosaurs called Maniraptora. The model below represents the evolutionary relationships amongst different groups of organisms. The bars indicate the time on Earth when these groups of organisms lived. The letters A, B, C, and D are descendants of the Maniraptora. Jurassic and Cretaceous refer to time periods in Earth's geologic history when dinosaurs existed.
problems/NY24G8S/media/27a.jpg
Which statement about the pattern observed in the model is most accurate?

A.Choice: There has been no change in life forms throughout much of geologic history.

B.Choice: There has been little diversity in life forms after the Maniraptora group.

C.Choice: Members of Oviraptorosauria are all extinct while members of Aves are still in existence.

D.Choice: All the descendants of Maniraptora have survived to the present day.

Content: Which pair of simulations can be used as evidence to support the claim that changing the masses of R and S, as well as changing the distance between the masses, affect the strength of the gravitational force that R exerts on S?

A.Choice: 1 and 2

B.Choice: 2 and 3

C.Choice: 3 and 4

D.Choice: 1 and 3

Content: Which argument about mass, distance, and gravitational force can be made using evidence from the table?

A.Choice: An increase in only the distance between the objects does not affect the strength of the gravitational force.

B.Choice: An increase in only the mass of one object does not affect the strength of the gravitational force.

C.Choice: An increase in only the distance between the objects decreases the strength of the gravitational force.

D.Choice: An increase in only the mass of one object decreases the strength of the gravitational force.

Content: Some satellites that orbit Earth, like the GOES-14 satellite, are geostationary. This geostationary satellite travels over the equator. It moves in the same direction and at the same rate Earth is spinning. From Earth, a geostationary satellite looks like it is standing still since it is always above the same location. In 2022, there were 402 geostationary satellites in orbit around Earth.
problems/NY24G8S/media/30a.jpg

Complete the model below by placing one arrow, from the four choices given, in a box around each object to indicate the direction of the gravitational force that Earth exerts on GOES-14 and the direction of the gravitational force that GOES-14 exerts on Earth.
problems/NY24G8S/media/30b.jpg

A.Choice: problems/NY24G8S/media/30c.jpg

B.Choice: problems/NY24G8S/media/30d.jpg

C.Choice: problems/NY24G8S/media/30e.jpg

D.Choice: problems/NY24G8S/media/30f.jpg

Content: The Hubble is a space telescope located in an orbit around Earth. It is powered by solar panels and it is approximately the same size and mass of a large school bus.

Fragments from non-functional satellites or even paint flecks from the International Space Station are found in space and called orbital debris. Hubble has evidence of impacts from this debris in the form of tiny impact craters across its solar panels. These tiny particles have struck Hubble at very fast speeds of up to 10 kilometers per second.
problems/NY24G8S/media/31a.jpg
problems/NY24G8S/media/31b.jpg
The force exerted on Hubble during a collision with space debris does NOT significantly affect the motion and location of this telescope. Which statement best explains this phenomenon?

A.Choice: The sum of the forces acting on Hubble is zero.

B.Choice: The mass of Hubble is less than the mass of the space debris.

C.Choice: Hubble exerts a stronger force on the space debris than the force exerted by the space debris on Hubble.

D.Choice: The mass of Hubble is very large and the strength of the force of impact is relatively small.

Content: The model below represents the locations of the Sun, Earth, and the Hubble telescope in our solar system. Earth and Hubble complete a trip around the Sun in a year, while Hubble completes a trip around Earth in approximately 95 minutes.
problems/NY24G8S/media/32a.jpg
Explain, in terms of forces, why Hubble stays in its orbit around Earth, and why Earth stays in its orbit around the Sun. Include BOTH Hubble-Earth and Sun-Earth interactions in your answer.
Which list identifies the names of the missing processes, numbered 1 through 3, of the rock cycle?

A.Choice: 1 = erosion; 2 = deformation; 3 = melting

B.Choice: 1 = deformation; 2 = melting; 3 = erosion

C.Choice: 1 = melting; 2 = deformation; 3 = erosion

D.Choice: 1 = deformation; 2 = erosion; 3 = melting

Content: Which two sources of energy are responsible for the cycling of Earth materials and the flow of energy, as shown in the rock cycle model?

A.Choice: the Sun and Earth's hot interior

B.Choice: Earth's hot interior and the Moon's hot interior

C.Choice: evaporation and condensation of water on Earth's surface

D.Choice: the Sun's energy and Earth's magnetic fields

Content: The map below shows Death Valley. The arrows on the model below indicate the direction of land movement that produced the valley.
problems/NY24G8S/media/35a.jpg
problems/NY24G8S/media/35b.jpg
Which piece of evidence would support the claim that Death Valley National Park is the result of past tectonic plate motions?

A.Choice: Death Valley is the lowest elevation in North America.

B.Choice: The locations of the mountain ranges on either side of Death Valley are almost parallel to each other.

C.Choice: There is thick sediment on the bottom of Death Valley.

D.Choice: There are uplifted mountain ranges on either side of Death Valley.

Content: In February 2005, Badwater Basin in Death Valley received about six inches of rain from streams flowing into the enclosed basin that flooded the area. The photographs below show this region shortly after the flood in February 2005 and again in February 2007, in which mineral salt deposits are clearly visible.
problems/NY24G8S/media/36a.jpg
problems/NY24G8S/media/36b.jpg
The salt flats region in Death Valley covers over 200 square miles. Salt flat formation requires:

:ibox:• a large basin where streams carry salts down to the basin
• an enclosed basin, like Death Valley, where the salts dissolved in stream water can be trapped and not wash away
• an arid climate with high temperatures to drive water cycle processes
The arrows on the water cycle model below represent the ways water changes its state as it moves through multiple pathways.
problems/NY24G8S/media/36c.jpg
Identify ONE water cycle process that is directly responsible for the formation of the large mineral salt flats in Death Valley and explain how this process is driven by energy from the Sun.
The climate graph below shows the average high and low air temperatures and the average monthly precipitation from 1981 through 2010 for Death Valley, California.
problems/NY24G8S/media/37a.jpg
Using the data as evidence, predict the season during which a flood is most likely to occur in Death Valley, California. Also, explain how the data provides evidence for your prediction.

A.Choice: Spring

B.Choice: Summer

C.Choice: Fall

D.Choice: Winter

Content: Which statement is a reasonable action that could be taken by Death Valley Park officials to mitigate the effects of flash floods or flooding events for park visitors?

A.Choice: Based on seasonal rainfall data, place barrels throughout the park to catch some of the extra rainfall.

B.Choice: Use precipitation data to decide when to post road closures and detours in areas that typically flood.

C.Choice: When any rainfall occurs, close the entire national park to prevent loss of property and life.

D.Choice: Build barriers along the sides of all roads in the national park to keep flood waters off the road at times of high precipitation events.

Content: Identify the carbon-based molecule that is formed when a sugar molecule is rearranged during cellular respiration.
The transfer of oxygen within the human body is partially shown in the model below. Hemoglobin is the protein that red blood cells use to transport oxygen.
problems/NY24G8S/media/40a.jpg
Use evidence from the model to explain how TWO organ systems work together to deliver oxygen to body cells for cellular respiration. Include BOTH organ systems in your explanation.
The model below represents cellular respiration taking place in an organelle within a body cell.
problems/NY24G8S/media/41a.jpg
Which organelle is represented in the model and is correctly paired with its function for the cell as a whole?

A.Choice: nucleus; control center of the cell

B.Choice: chloroplast; captures energy to make food

C.Choice: mitochondrion; releases energy from food

D.Choice: cell membrane; allows food to enter and wastes to leave the cell

Content: Sherpas are an ethnic group that live on the high southern slopes of the Himalaya Mountains in eastern Nepal. They are famous for their hiking skills and for guiding experienced hikers to the summit (top) of Mount Everest at 8848 meters (29,032 feet), carrying heavy loads.

Sherpas have lived on the high plateau of the Himalayas at an average altitude of more than 4480 meters (14,700 feet) going back at least 6,000 years when the earliest settlement appeared. This is a period of time sufficient to drive the natural selection of genetic variants favoring survival and performance in the low oxygen environment of mountain locations.
problems/NY24G8S/media/42a.jpg
Which argument describes how the high altitude environment of the Himalayan region has affected the Sherpa population?

A.Choice: Sherpas make glucose more efficiently than populations living at lower altitudes.

B.Choice: Sherpas produce less carbon dioxide during cellular respiration than populations living at lower altitudes.

C.Choice: Sherpas release more oxygen during cellular respiration than populations living at lower altitudes.

D.Choice: Sherpas perform cellular respiration more efficiently with less oxygen than populations living at lower altitudes.

Content: Natural selection has caused a genetic trait of Sherpas to change over a long period of time by

A.Choice: decreasing the frequency of a favorable trait through asexual reproduction

B.Choice: decreasing the frequency of a favorable trait through sexual reproduction

C.Choice: increasing the frequency of a favorable trait through asexual reproduction

D.Choice: increasing the frequency of a favorable trait through sexual reproduction

Content: The model below represents a food web within an ecosystem which includes the bluebird.
problems/NY24G8S/media/44a.jpg
Which table shows a correct interaction that the bluebird has with another organism in this food web?

A.Choice: problems/NY24G8S/media/44b.jpg

B.Choice: problems/NY24G8S/media/44c.jpg

C.Choice: problems/NY24G8S/media/44d.jpg

D.Choice: problems/NY24G8S/media/44e.jpg

Content: A student writes an explanation about the relationship between the bluebird and the corn using information from the food web model. They stated that “the corn is a direct food source for the bluebird.”

Revise the explanation to indicate the correct relationship between the bluebird and an organism that is a food source for the bluebird. Use evidence from the food web model to support the revised explanation.

The house sparrow is another bird commonly found in New York State. These birds frequently take over the nests and destroy the eggs of other birds. Once a male house sparrow establishes a territory, he remains there year-round and defends that territory, preventing other bird species from building nests in the area. House sparrows eat mostly grains and seeds, but, in summer, will eat insects and feed them to their young.
problems/NY24G8S/media/46a.jpg

From the list of interactions below, identify the pattern of interaction that a house sparrow would have with a bluebird in a particular ecosystem. Describe two environmental factors that create this pattern of interaction.

A.Choice: competition

B.Choice: mutualism

C.Choice: parasitism

Content: The maps below compare the range of the Eastern bluebird for our current worldwide average temperature and the predicted ranges for a worldwide average temperature 2°C greater than at present. A species range is the geographic area where a particular species can be found during its lifetime.

Scientists infer a 2°C increase in global temperatures could happen as early as 2050 without mitigation efforts. Rising global temperatures have the potential to alter ecosystems that affect the ranges of many species.
problems/NY24G8S/media/47a.jpg
problems/NY24G8S/media/47b.jpg
Which evidence found on the maps supports the argument that changes to worldwide average temperatures affect the range of the Eastern bluebird?

A.Choice: The increase in average temperatures will cause the Eastern bluebird range to increase only into the San Antonio region.

B.Choice: The increase in average temperatures will cause the Eastern bluebird range to decrease only in the Minneapolis-Bismarck region.

C.Choice: As the climate warms, Eastern bluebird ranges will decrease west of Oklahoma City and shift farther north into the Toronto region.

D.Choice: As the climate warms, the range of the Eastern bluebird will shift south to Miami and west toward Cheyenne.

Content: The use of synthetic pesticides in the United States began in the 1930s. These pesticides killed insects that ate food crops. This use continued in the 1950s in order to increase the amount of food produced on farms. Some pesticides were found to have considerable health risks, including causing forms of cancer, and the use of some pesticides has been banned in the United States.
problems/NY24G8S/media/48a.jpg
Farmers today have tried to use methods to control insects that are not harmful to the environment. One method is to place bluebird boxes around their crops to encourage bluebirds to live there.
problems/NY24G8S/media/48b.jpg
How does the use of bluebird boxes on farms minimize the impact of pesticides on the environment?

A.Choice: Bluebirds living in bluebird boxes decrease the number of insects on farms with minimal health risks to humans.

B.Choice: Bluebirds living in bluebird boxes pollinate the plants that would otherwise be pollinated with pesticides.

C.Choice: Bluebird boxes are more expensive to buy and maintain than buying and using pesticides.

D.Choice: Bluebird boxes attract other types of birds to the area which discourage insects from eating crops.

Content: How many different types of atoms make up ONE molecule of propane?
Provide evidence to support the claim that a chemical reaction has occurred during the combustion of propane.
The reaction for the burning of propane shows a conservation of matter because

A.Choice: water is produced during the reaction

B.Choice: energy is produced during the reaction

C.Choice: the mass of the water and carbon dioxide equals the mass of the propane and oxygen

D.Choice: the volume of the water and carbon dioxide equals the volume of the propane and oxygen

Content: The model below represents one molecule of propane.
problems/NY24G8S/media/52a.jpg

Develop a ball and stick model of ONE water molecule showing the correct orientation and arrangement of the individual atoms by arranging the symbols in the grid below. Symbols may be used more than once.

Two containers, A and B, are shown below. Container A represents a model of the arrangement of six particles of liquid water. In Container B, a student made a model of these same six particles after thermal energy was added and the water became water vapor. The student's particle diagram was incorrectly drawn.
problems/NY24G8S/media/53a.jpg
Explain how the particles should be drawn to correctly represent the particle arrangement of water vapor. [1]
